data.title: Company Overview & News
data.meta_description: Ferrari NV is a holding company. It manufactures luxury sports cars. The firm's models include the F12Berlinetta, 488GTB, 488 Spider, 458 Speciale, California
data.text:
Red Velvet Earns Their First Top 10 On One Of Billboard’s Most Competitive Charts

Red Velvet’s new EP Cosmic debuts on this week’s Top Album Sales chart at No. 6. It's the first top 10 on Billboard’s ranking of the bestselling titles in the U.S. for the band.

Dave Meltzer’s ‘Internal Memo’ Gaffe Caps A Week Of Faulty Reporting

2024 has not been kind to Dave Meltzer, who continues to misreport one story after another.

Lionel Messi Left Out Of Argentina World Cup 2026 Qualifying Squad

Argentina take on Chile and Colombia in crucial FIFA World Cup qualification matches this September, but legendary captain Lionel Messi will not be in attendance.

Kursk Operation Exposes Putin’s Weakness

Peter Zalmayev, Ukraine director for the Eurasia Democracy Initiative, talks about recent developments in Ukraine, reflects on global media coverage of Russia’s invasion.

AUTHOR POST | Paid Program

Building Multimodal AI: Feeling Through the Dark

Multimodal AI can sense its surroundings, but is still in its infancy. Technology leaders continue to push the boundaries of what’s possible to bring it to maturity.

Who Is Mike Lynch? Tech Entrepreneur And Daughter Hannah Lynch Missing After Yacht Sinks Near Sicily

Lynch, a former Forbes billionaire, made his fortune as the CEO of Autonomy, a tech company acquired by HP in a sale that led to more than a decade of legal strife.

Stray Kids Are Racking Up Gold Records In America

Stray Kids' “Thunderous” has been certified gold by the RIAA for moving half a million units in the U.S., marking their fourth such win.

Amid A Push For Office Returns, Some CEOs Get A Remote Perk

The published version of Forbes' Future of Work newsletter delivers the latest news for chief human resources officers and other talent managers on disruptive technologies, managing the workforce and trends in the remote work debate to your inbox every Monday.

Will Trump’s Tariffs Raise Prices? What To Know As Kamala Harris Slams ‘Trump Tax’

If enacted, economists believe Trump’s tariff plan could cost middle-class households at least $1,700 per year.

Jimin’s ‘Be Mine’ Climbs To A New Peak On Multiple Charts Simultaneously

Jimin's "Be Mine" reaches a new peak on both of Billboard's global charts as it returns in a new high point.

How The Economy Really Fared Under Biden And Trump–From Jobs To Inflation

Here’s your economic primer ahead of the Democratic National Convention as both parties spin a rosy economic picture during the complicated last decade.

Ahead Of The 2024-25 Season More NBA Teams Have Dropped Their RSN

With a new NBA season starting soon, this month two additonal NBA franchises dropped their regional sports network, bringing the number to four. More can be expected.

Taylor Swift’s ‘The Tortured Poets Department’ Hits No. 1 On Every Chart In America–Almost

Taylor Swift’s The Tortured Poets Department appears at No. 1 on three different Billboard charts this week—and it missed out on a fourth by just one space.

Vanessa Gilles: From Tennis Courts To One Of The World’s Best Defenders

A prime example that there is no single path to becoming a professional soccer player.

Pittsburgh Pirates Pick Perennial Prime Prospect Billy McKinney

Billy McKinney is baseball's cat with nine lives. The Pittsburgh Pirates, his ninth organization, called up the guy everybody wants until they get him and send him away.
